trait.name: Ethereal Form
entries: The Twilight Chimera has resistance to all physical damage (except radiant) while on the Material Plane. Attacks against it are made with disadvantage unless the attacker can see ethereal creatures.

trait.name: Mistfire Glow
entries: The Chimera radiates a pulsing shadowy aura up to 15 feet. Any hostile creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The Twilight Chimera has three independent heads, each with unique abilities:
- {@b Lion:} Emits a spectral blue flame. Its bite attacks deal additional fire damage.
- {@b Serpent:} Its gaze forces a creature to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition confused} until the end of its next turn.
- {@b Eagle:} Its screech disorients enemies in a 15-foot cone.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Twilight Chimera makes three attacks: one bite, one headbutt, and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite (Lion Head)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) spectral fire damage.

action.name: Headbutt (Eagle Head)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Strike
entries: When the Chimera takes damage from a melee attack within 5 feet, it can use its reaction to make a bite attack against the attacker.

legendary.name: Shadow Dash
entries: The Chimera moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Ficha Estilizada
entries: Confira a ficha estilizada completa da {@link Quimera Crepuscular|https://homebrewery.naturalcrit.com/share/tu1h1yguKbxa}.

trait.name: Unshakable Will
entries: Torak has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Torak is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Instinctive Reflex
entries: Torak can take the Dodge action as a bonus action on his turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Torak makes two attacks with his staff or unarmed strikes.

action.name: Staff Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) if used with two hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away.

action.name: Ki Wave (Recharge 5-6)
entries: Torak releases a burst of ki energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Step of the Wind
entries: Torak can Dash or Disengage as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: When Torak is hit by a ranged weapon attack, he can reduce the damage by 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}). If the damage is reduced to 0, he can catch the projectile if it is small enough to hold in one hand.

fluff.name: Torak, Guardian of Instinct
entries: Torak is a disciplined warrior who channels his instincts through years of rigorous training. He guards ancient secrets in a remote monastery, protecting them from those who seek power for malicious purposes. Torak's style combines precise strikes with a deep understanding of his opponents' movements, making him a fearsome adversary in combat.

{@b Goals} Torak seeks balance in all things, viewing himself as a protector of harmony. He is a steadfast ally to those who share his values, but he is unyielding against those who threaten the peace.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Arista is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Crystalline Logic
entries: Arista can use her reaction to impose disadvantage on a saving throw against an enchantment or illusion spell she casts.

trait.name: Runic Glow
entries: The runes on Arista's body glow softly, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius. She can suppress or reactivate this light as a bonus action.

trait.name: Ethereal Tome
entries: A magical book floats in front of Arista, assisting her in combat. The tome can fire magical projectiles using her spell attack bonus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Arista makes two attacks with her Tome Strike.

action.name: Tome Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Illusory Barrage (Recharge 5-6)
entries: Arista conjures a flurry of illusions in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not blinded.

bonus.name: Misty Retreat
entries: Arista can cast {@spell misty step} as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. She can use this ability once per short or long rest.

fluff.name: Arista, Guardian of Reason
entries: Arista is a serene and composed figure, embodying the ideal of reason and logic. Her glowing runes symbolize her unwavering dedication to truth and clarity. Her tome, an extension of her will, serves as both a weapon and a tool for enlightenment.
{@b Goals} Arista seeks to dispel ignorance and deception, using her abilities to foster understanding and peace.

trait.name: Expert Alchemist
entries: The agent can create three potions per day of common or uncommon rarity. They carry them and use the potions before and during combat.

trait.name: Favoured by Thoth-Hermes (1/day)
entries: The agent of the order invokes the name of their deity as a bonus action. The agent becomes invisible and immune to nonmagical weapon damage until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Student of the Spirit
entries: The agent has studied spiritual treatises from the Emerald Tablets, granting them the ability to commune with spirits. They can cast Speak with Dead three times per day.

trait.name: Appearance
entries: The Announcer wears a metal mask and green robes. They carry a staff that emits a faint green glow.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The agent of the order makes two staff attacks.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the agent drinks a potion of hill giant strength, the attack bonus becomes +7 and damage becomes 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sixth Sense (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The agent of the order allows themself to be guided by the spirit world, granting advantage on their next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Announcer is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). They have the following spells prepared:

ac.condition: with {@spell mage armor} and Iron Obsidian Mask

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dromdal-re is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). He wields esoteric shadow magic granted by the Emerald Tablets.
footerEntries: *Dromdal casts these spells on himself before combat if he is aware of the threat.

trait.name: Iron Obsidian Mask
entries: While wearing the mask, Dromdal has advantage on Intimidation checks and resistance to psychic damage. Once per day, as a bonus action, he can cast {@spell silence} without components.

trait.name: Command Action
entries: Once per round, Dromdal can use a bonus action to command an allied creature (such as the Iron Bicéphale) to use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make a melee attack or attempt to grapple a target.

action.name: Nullifying Touch
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the attack hits, the target can't benefit from damage resistance caused by magic until the end of Dron'dal's next turn.

monster.name: Bicephalous Iron Golem (Bicéfalo de Ferro)

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Anti-Magic Bastion
entries: The golem is unaffected by spells of 6th level or lower (including spell attacks and magical effects from such spells). Spells of 7th level or higher affect it normally. Magical effects from magic items still function unless they replicate a spell of 6th level or lower.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Two Heads, Six Arms
entries: The golem can take up to two reactions per round, but no more than one per triggering event.

trait.name: Juggernaut Protocol
entries: The golem has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove or grapple, and creatures it is grappling are restrained instead of grappled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Slam attacks. If at least two Slams hit the same target on its turn, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or is knocked prone and grappled (escape DC 16). While grappled this way, the target is restrained.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Seismic Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem slams the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, a creature is also pushed 10 feet away from the golem and knocked prone.

reaction.name: Shoulder Shield
entries: When a creature the golem can see hits it with a melee attack, the golem reduces the damage by {@damage 1d8 + 5}.

reaction.name: Body-Block
entries: When a creature the golem can see moves within 5 feet of the golem, the golem can make a shove against that creature. On a success, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its turn.

fluff.name: Bicephalous Iron Golem (Bicéfalo de Ferro)
entries: Forged for anti-mage warfare, this towering construct bears two watchful helms and six crushing arms. Its carapace is etched with void-runic seams that swallow lesser spells, and its singular directive is to body-guard its master and deny intruders any path to the objective.
